Product Description: Alexa is a virtual assistant by Amazon
Alexa is an AI technology developed by Amazon.
Alexa is capable of voice interaction.
Alexa can provide weather, traffic, sports, and other real-time information.
Alexa can also control several smart devices using itself as a home automation system.
Users are able to extend the Alexa capabilities by installing "skills" such as weather programs.
Devices with Alexa allow users to activate the device using a wake-word such as Alexa
Amazon has more than 10,000 employees working on Alexa and related products.
Echo Studio became the first smart speaker with 360 sound and Dolby sound
New devices included an Echo dot with a clock behind the fabric.
Alexa was inspired by the computer voice and conversation system on board the Starship Enterprise in science fiction TV series and movies.
Amazon developers chose the name Alexa because it has a hard consonant with the X
The hard consonant helps it be recognized with higher precision.
Amazon has said the name is reminiscent of the Library of Alexandria
Amazon opened its first Alexa-themed pop-up shop inside of Toronto?s Eaton Centre.
The shop showcased the use of home automation products with Amazon's smart speakers.
Amazon also sells Alexa devices at Amazon Books stores throughout the United States.
A companion app is available from the Apple AppStore, Google Play, and Amazon Appstore
The app can be used by owners of Alexa-enabled devices to install skills, control music, manage alarms, and view shopping lists.
The app also allows users to review the recognized text on the app screen and to send feedback to Amazon concerning whether the recognition was good or bad.
A web interface is also available to set up compatible devices.
Alexa can perform a number of preset functions out-of-the-box such as set timers, share the current weather, create lists.
Users say a designated wake word to alert an Alexa-enabled device of an ensuing function command.
Alexa listens for the command and performs the appropriate function, or skill, to answer a question or command.
When questions are asked, Alexa converts sound waves into text which allows it to gather information from various sources.
The data gathered is then sometimes passed to a variety of sources including WolframAlpha, iMDB, AccuWeather, Yelp, Wikipedia and others to generate suitable and accurate answers.
Alexa-supported devices can stream music from the owner's Amazon Music accounts
Alexa can play music from streaming services such as Apple Music and Google Play Music from a phone or tablet.
Alexa can also perform additional functions through third-party skills that users can enable.
Amazon has over 90,000 functions available for users to download on their Alexa-enabled devices.
In the home automation space, Alexa can interact with devices from several manufacturers worldwide.
In the Home Automation feature, developers are able to create their own smart home skills using the Alexa Skills Kit.
Amazon recently announced a microwave oven that can be paired and controlled with an Echo device.
The oven is sold under Amazon's AmazonBasics label.
Alexa can now pair with a Ring doorbell Pro and greet visitors.
Alexa can also leave instructions about where to deliver packages.
Take-out food can be ordered using Alexa.
Few years back Starbucks announced a private beta for placing pick-up orders using Alexa.
Users can order meals using Amazon Prime Now via Alexa in 20 major US cities.
With Amazon Key, Alexa also works together with the smart lock and the Alexa Cloud Cam.
This technology allows Amazon couriers to unlock customers' front doors and deliver packages inside.
Alexa supports a multitude of subscription-based and free streaming services on Amazon devices.
Alexa is able to stream media and music directly.
Linking the Alexa's device to the Amazon account enables access to one's Amazon Music library.
Amazon Prime members have an additional ability to access stations, playlists, and over two million songs free of charge.
Amazon Music Unlimited subscribers also have access to a list of millions of songs.
Amazon Music for PC allows one to play personal music from Google Play, iTunes, and others on an Alexa device.
Up to 250 songs can be uploaded free of charge.
Alexa can play this music and control playback through voice command options once songs are uploaded.
Amazon Alexa allows the user to hear updates on supported sports teams.
Once the sports teams are added to the list created under Alexa's Sports Update app section it is possible to access this feature.
There are a number of ways messages can be sent from Alexa's application.
Alexa can deliver messages to a recipient's Alexa application, as well as to all supported Echo devices associated with their Amazon account.
Alexa can send typed messages only from Alexa's app.
If one sends a message from an associated Echo device, it transmits as a voice message.
Alexa cannot send attachments such as videos and photos.
For households with more than one member, one's Alexa contacts are pooled across all of the devices that are registered to its associated account.
When accessed and supported by an Alexa app or Echo device, Alexa messaging is available to anyone in one's household.
These messages can be heard by anyone with access to the household.
This messaging feature does not yet contain a password protection.
Anyone who has access to one's cell phone number is able to use this feature to contact them through their supported Alexa app or Echo device.
The feature to block alerts for messages and calls is available temporarily by utilizing the Do Not Disturb feature.
Alexa for Business is a paid subscription service allowing companies to use Alexa to join conference calls and schedule meeting rooms.
The digital assistant can notify the user when a severe weather warning is issued in that area.
Alexa can update the users about their commute, traffic conditions or directions.
Alexa can also send the information to the user's phone.
Amazon allows developers to build and publish skills for Alexa using the Alexa Skills Kit known as Alexa Skills.
The third-party-developed skills are available across Alexa-enabled devices.
Users can enable these skills using the Alexa app.
A Smart Home Skill API is available, meant to be used by hardware manufacturers to allow users to control smart home devices.
Most skills run code almost entirely in the cloud, using Amazon?s AWS Lambda service.
Amazon launched Blueprints, a tool for individuals to build skills for their personal use.
Amazon further expanded the capability of Blueprints by allowing customers to publish skills they've built with the templates to its Alexa Skill Store in the US.
These skills can be used by anyone with an Alexa-enabled device.
Amazon allows device manufacturers to integrate Alexa voice capabilities into their own connected products by using the Alexa Voice Service (AVS).
Alexa Voice Service is a cloud-based service that provides APIs to interface with Alexa.
Products built using AVS have access to Alexa's growing list of capabilities including all of the Alexa Skills.
AVS provides cloud-based automatic speech recognition (ASR) and natural language understanding (NLU).
There are no fees for companies looking to integrate Alexa into their products by using AVS.
The voice of Amazon Alexa is generated by a long short-term memory artificial neural network.
Alexa was able to help its users apply to jobs at McDonald?s using voice recognition services.
It is the world's first employment service using voice command service.
Amazon announced that Alexa will soon be able to mimic celebrities voices costing $0.99 for each voice.
Recently, Alexa has also started replying to Spanish voice commands in Spanish.
Amazon has also announced that they would make the speech recognition and natural language processing technology behind Alexa available for developers under the name of Amazon Lex.
Amazon Lex service would allow developers to create their own chatbots that can interact in a conversational manner, similar to that of Alexa.
Along with the connection to various Amazon services, the initial version will provide connectivity to Facebook Messenger.
There are concerns about the access Amazon has to private conversations in the home
There are also concerns about non-verbal indications that can identify who is present in the home with non-stop audio pick-up from Alexa-enabled devices.
Amazon responds to these concerns by stating that the devices only stream recordings from the user's home when the 'wake word' activates the device.
Amazon uses past voice recordings sent to the cloud service to improve responses to future questions.
Users can delete voice recordings that are associated with their account.
Alexa uses an address stored in the companion app when it needs a location.
Alexa uses the user's location to respond to requests for nearby restaurants or stores.
Similarly, Alexa uses the user's location for mapping-related requests.
Amazon retains digital recordings of users' audio spoken after the "wake word".
The audio recordings are subject to demands by law enforcement, government agents, and other entities via subpoena.
Amazon publishes some information about the warrants, subpoenas and warrant-less demands it receives.
Echo could be connected and used to control a Tesla car.
Some journalists voiced concerns about such levels of connectivity as it could be abused and used by hackers to take control of the car.
Alexa has been known to listen in on private conversation and store personal information which was hacked and sent to the hacker.
Although Amazon has announced that this was a rare occurrence, Alexa shows the dangers of using technology and sharing private information with robotics.
